meanings.definition: To separate grain from (a plant) by beating
meanings.sent1: The farmer used a stick to thresh the wheat and separate the grains.
meanings.sent2: She had to thresh the rice to prepare it for cooking.
meanings.sent3: As the wind blew, the scarecrow began to thresh its arms wildly.
meanings.sent4: The waves threshed against the shore, trying to break free.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's feet threshed the ground rhythmically, creating a mesmerizing sound.

meanings.sent1: He had to thresh the rug to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent2: The blacksmith would thresh the metal to shape it into tools.
meanings.sent3: The chef began to thresh the dough to make it soft and pliable.
meanings.sent4: The storm winds threshed the trees, bending them to their will.
meanings.sent5: The boxer continued to thresh his opponent with powerful punches.

meanings.definition: To move the legs energetically and noisily
meanings.sent1: The toddler would thresh his legs in excitement when he saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: The dancers began to thresh their legs in time with the music.
meanings.sent3: The puppy started to thresh its legs in a playful manner, chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: The soccer player threshed his legs to run faster towards the goal.
meanings.sent5: The crowd cheered as the marching band threshed their legs in perfect unison.
